summary: interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA) is more specific than the tuberculin skin test to discriminate between tuberculosis (TB) and nontuberculous mycobacterial (NTM) diseases. 58 patients with NTM diseases had a T-SPOT.TB performed. 30 patients had definite NTM diseases, 28 had probable diseases. significant portion of NTM diseases were T-SPOT.TB positive in china. the IGRA assay show limited value in the discrimination. further research is needed to investigate the association between TB infection and treatment for NTM patients.
